headline.main: Heart Group Stresses Food Over Numbers in Diet

docs.abstract: American Heart Association revises its dietary guidelines to emphasize common sense in choosing daily fare and to play down percentages of fat or nutrients in foods; advises two weekly servings of fatty fish like tuna or salmon (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: The American Heart Association revised its influential dietary guidelines today to emphasize common sense in choosing daily fare and to play down the percentages of fat or nutrients in foods. ''We are moving toward a diet that focuses on food rather than strictly on the numbers,'' said Dr. Ronald M. Krauss, the lead author of the report.
docs.snippet: The American Heart Association revised its influential dietary guidelines today to emphasize common sense in choosing daily fare and to play down the percentages of fat or nutrients in foods.    ''We are moving toward a diet that focuses on food...

docs.abstract: Researchers believe that parents who constantly diet but give into temptation at first sight of some rich food may be contributing to obesity in their children; have linked serious weight problems in young children with parents who dieted constantly but also binged (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: People who constantly diet but give in to temptation at the first sight of some rich food learn the hard way that this is a singularly ineffective way to control weight. Now, researchers believe it may also contribute to obesity in their children.
docs.snippet: People who constantly diet but give in to temptation at the first sight of some rich food learn the hard way that this is a singularly ineffective way to control weight.    Now, researchers believe it may also contribute to obesity in their children.
